subsection_content:
According to urology experts, Center for Urology and Nephrology, Tam Anh General Hospital, there are many causes of prostatitis.
1. Microorganisms
The urinary tract is one of the organs that contains a lot of bacteria such as E.coli, Proteus, Mycoplasma fungus, Enterobacter... These bacteria can enter the prostate through the urethra, causing acute prostatitis. acute and chronic. Sometimes, bacteria can also travel back up the spermatic duct causing orchitis, epididymitis...
2. Immune system response
Prostatitis can also be an immune system response to a urinary tract infection.
3. Damage caused by procedures
Some cases of prostatitis are not related to a bacterial cause. Patients have inflammation  due to procedures related to the urethra, after prostate biopsy, due to injury or trauma when playing sports, vigorous exercise...
4. Unknown cause
Sometimes prostatitis has no specific cause.
subsection_title: viem tuyen tien liet.json. What causes prostatitis?
